V.iii.3.1.f
.
Evaluating Long-Term Health Effects of 38 CFR 3.317 Infectious Diseases
As applicable, consider the long-term health effects potentially associated with infectious diseases as listed in
38 CFR 3.317(d)
, specifically for brucellosis, Campylobacter jejuni, Coxiella burnetii (Q fever), malaria, Mycobacterium tuberculosis, nontyphoid Salmonella, Shigella, visceral leishmaniasis, and West Nile virus.
Reference
:Â  For more information on presumptive SC for infectious diseases under
38 CFR 3.317
, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart ii, 1.A.1.p
.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 3 - Infectious Diseases, Immune Disorders, and Nutritional Deficiencies
citation: Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 3, Section None
